result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter J. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Peter J. Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Peter J. Johnson was found guilty of Fail/Report Death-Unusual Circumstances, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 979.01(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

TTP slip

Case called at 11:20am [mo] 
Defendant Peter J. Johnson in court, in custody with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Hall reminds the Court that Count #1 of the Complaint was stricken at a previous hearing, therefore the only remaining count is Count #2 
Attorney Zarwell admits service and waives reading of Amended Complaint

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall
--ADA Hall orally motions for the charging lanuguage of the original complaint be used at sentencing
--The Court grants the motion and notes it did use the charging language on the original complaint when reciting to Defendant 
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Zarwell 

On Count #2 The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 58 days in Jefferson County Jail; time served sentence  
--58 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443,  within 90 days; non-payment shall result in a 10 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
recess:11:38am
Status conference on May 7, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 6, 2015 at 09:40 am.

Reserve Judge O'Brien presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 9:55am. 
Defendant Peter J. Johnson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.

The Court requires a $500 cash bond, with condition:
--to be booked at the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today.
recess 10:03am.
